SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.uiPublic
Class GlobalSearchOptions

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.uiPublic.GlobalSearchOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class GlobalSearchOptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An optional class of options to be passed into Global Search from a UIShell page or the Global Search taskflow.

For example, in a managed bean an instance of this class can be created:


 public class SomeManagedBean
   implements Serializable
    {
      public GlobalSearchOptions getSimpleOptions()
      {
        GlobalSearchOptions ret = new GlobalSearchOptions();
        ret.setSavedSearchesEnabled(false);
        ret.setRecentSearchesEnabled(false);
        ret.setSubCategoriesEnabled(false);
        ret.setFilterLOVStyle(FilterLOVStyle.INLINE);

        return ret;
      }

The values could be hardcoded like this, or derived from profile options, a configuration table or as required by the implementation team. This could be referenced from a UISHell jspx page using the "GlobalSearchOptions" attribute:

 <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
 <jsp:root xmlns:jsp="http://java.sun.com/JSP/Page" version="2.1"
           xmlns:f="http://java.sun.com/jsf/core"
           xmlns:h="http://java.sun.com/jsf/html"
           xmlns:af="http://xmlns.oracle.com/adf/faces/rich">
   <jsp:directive.page contentType="text/html;charset=UTF-8"/>
   <f:view locale="#{applCorePrefs.locale}">
     <af:document id="d1">
       <af:pageTemplate viewId="/oracle/apps/fnd/applcore/templates/UIShell.jspx"
                        value="#{bindings.pageTemplateBinding}" id="pt1">
         <f:facet name="ThirdPartyComponentArea"/>
         <f:facet name="SingleObjectContextArea"/>
         <f:facet name="HomePageContent"/>
         <f:attribute name="GlobalSearchOptions"
                      value="#{SomeManagedBean.simpleOptions}"/>
       </af:pageTemplate>
     </af:document>
   </f:view>
 </jsp:root>

In this case the options would stay in effect for the duration of this page.

Alternately this could be passed to the Global Search taskflow (Global Search running in a UIShell tab).
Here is an example from a taskflow menu:


 <itemNode focusViewId="/TestUIShellPage"
                 id="itemNode_GlobalSearchDave1task-flow-definition"
                 label="Where's Dave?" taskType="dynamicMain"
                 taskFlowId="/WEB-INF/oracle/apps/fnd/applcore/globalSearch/uiPublic/GlobalSearch.xml#GlobalSearch"
                 forceRefresh="true" reuseInstance="false"
                 parametersList="SearchString=DAVE;GlobalSearchOptions=#{SomeManagedBean.simpleOptions}"
                 keyList="dave1"/>

Note: This class is expected to grow over time as new options are added. DO NOT rely on the Serialized form of this class, it will change as extra options are added.

Since:
11.1.1.7.2
See Also:

SEARCH_FIELD_MIN_MAXIMUM_LENGTH

public static final int SEARCH_FIELD_MIN_MAXIMUM_LENGTH
The smallest maximum number of characters the search field can take. This will determine the columns value of the search field inputText.

public static java.util.List<SearchSuggestGroupOption> getDefaultGlobalSearchSuggestGroups()
Obtain a List of the default Global Search Search Suggest groups. These are the group that will be shown in UISHell by default.

Returns:
A mutable list of options. The developer may modify this list before setting it back on this class.

setSavedSearchesEnabled

public void setSavedSearchesEnabled(boolean saveSearchEnabled)
Set saved searches enabled. Includes the list shown to the user, the save button and the save suggest group. By default this is true.

Parameters:
saveSearchEnabled - true to enable, false otherwise.

isSavedSearchesEnabled

public boolean isSavedSearchesEnabled()
Are saved searches enabled?

Returns:
true if enabled, false otherwise.

setRecentSearchesEnabled

public void setRecentSearchesEnabled(boolean recentSearchEnabled)
Set recent searches enabled. This enable/disables the ability for recent searches to be saved but does not affect the displaying of the autosuggest group; make sure the saved search group is not present to hide recent search suggestions.

Parameters:
recentSearchEnabled - true to enable, false otherwise.

isRecentSearchesEnabled

public boolean isRecentSearchesEnabled()
Are recent searches enabled?

Returns:
true if enabled, false otherwise.

setSubCategoriesEnabled

public void setSubCategoriesEnabled(boolean subCategoriesEnabled)
Set whether sub category (searchable object) filters are enabled. If this is set to false, facets will be disabled as well.

Parameters:
subCategoriesEnabled - true to enable.

isSubCategoriesEnabled

public boolean isSubCategoriesEnabled()
Is subcategory display enabled?

Returns:
true if enabled, false otherwise.

setFacetsEnabled

public void setFacetsEnabled(boolean facetsEnabled)
Set facets enabled. If set to false, facet counts are also disabled.

Parameters:
facetsEnabled - true to enable.

isFacetsEnabled

public boolean isFacetsEnabled()
Is facet display enabled? Subcategory display must be enabled for this to make any sence, as facets are dependent on subcategory selection.

Returns:
true if enabled, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if enabled, false otherwise.

setCategoryApplicationStripeFilter

public void setCategoryApplicationStripeFilter(java.lang.String categoryApplicationStripe)
Set the category application stripe. If set this will be compared to the ECSF_SEARCH_ENGINE_GROUP.APPLICATION value for each category (exact match), as well as category names (if supplied). Categories that do not match are not shown to the user.

Parameters:
categoryApplicationStripe - application stripe, for example "CRM".
See Also:
setCategoryNamesFilter(java.util.List)

getCategoryApplicationStripeFilter

public java.lang.String getCategoryApplicationStripeFilter()
Get the category application Stripe. By default this in null.

Returns:
category application Stripe.

searchSuggestGroups - List of groups.

setCategoryNamesFilter

public void setCategoryNamesFilter(java.util.List<java.lang.String> categoryNamesFilter)
Set the list of category names the user is allowed to see.
This is used in conjunction with the application Stripe if supplied. Each category name is the untranslated name from the ECSF_SEARCH_ENGINE_GROUP.NAME table.

Parameters:
categoryNamesFilter - possibly null list of names.
See Also:
setCategoryApplicationStripeFilter(java.lang.String)

getCategoryNamesFilter

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCategoryNamesFilter()
Get the Category names filter, by default an empty list.

Returns:
Category names filter.

setFilterLOVStyle

public void setFilterLOVStyle(GlobalSearchOptions.FilterLOVStyle filterLOVStyle)
Set the filter style, inline or LOV (the default) dictating how the filters are shown in the search results UI. Only categories currently obey this rule, other filters are always shown as LOVs.

Parameters:
filterLOVStyle - LOV or INLINE.

getFilterLOVStyle

public GlobalSearchOptions.FilterLOVStyle getFilterLOVStyle()

Returns:
filter LOV style.

Set the minimum number of chars before search suggest starts to provide suggestions. Must be between 2 and 5.

Parameters:
searchSuggestMinCharCount - minimum char count.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not between 2 and 5.

Parameters:
searchSuggestMaxSuggestedItems - maximum items.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if not between 5 and 50.

setLastUpdateDateFilter

public void setLastUpdateDateFilter(java.lang.String lastUpdateDateFilter)
Set the Last Update Date Filter. This is a comma separated list of Last Update Date filters that are to be shown in the Last Update Date LOV.
The valid List is: TODAY
  • THIS_WEEK
  • THIS_MONTH
  • THIS_YEAR
  • CUSTOM_RANGE
    • A null value implies all values. As an example "TODAY, THIS_YEAR" would show only 2 values.

    Parameters:
    lastUpdateDateFilter -

    getLastUpdateDateFilter

    public java.lang.String getLastUpdateDateFilter()
    Get the Last Update Date Filter.

    Returns:
    Last Update Date Filter.

    setSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled

    public void setSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled(boolean searchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled)
    Set whether the search category filter is shown next to the search field in the search popover, or in the GlobalSearchField taskflow. This does not affect the category filters in the filters area of the results window.

    Parameters:
    searchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled -

    isSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled

    public boolean isSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled()
    Is the search category filter is shown next to the search field in the search popover, or in the GlobalSearchField taskflow. This does not affect the category filters in the filters area of the results window.

    Returns:
    true if the category filters are to be shown (the default), false otherwise.

    setSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled

    public void setSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled(boolean searchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled)
    Set whether the search groups filter is shown next to the search field in the GlobalSearchField taskflow used in UIShell.

    Parameters:
    searchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled -

    isSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled

    public boolean isSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled()
    Is the search groups filter is shown next to the search field in the GlobalSearchField taskflow used in UIShell.

    Returns:
    true if the groups filters are to be shown (the default), false otherwise.

    setClearSearchFieldOnSearch

    public void setClearSearchFieldOnSearch(GlobalSearchOptions.ClearSearchField clearSearchFieldOnSearch)
    Do we clear the popover search field after a search. Applies to the Search popover used in UIShell, the GlobalSearchField taskflow.

    Parameters:
    clearSearchFieldOnSearch - enumerated directive.

    getClearSearchFieldOnSearch

    public GlobalSearchOptions.ClearSearchField getClearSearchFieldOnSearch()
    Do we clear the popover search field after a search. Applies to the Search popover used in UIShell, the GlobalSearchField taskflow. The default is OFF.

    Returns:
    directive on whether search fields are cleared.

    setSearchFieldMaximumLength

    public void setSearchFieldMaximumLength(int searchFieldMaximumLength)
    Set the search field length.

    Parameters:
    searchFieldMaximumLength - length of the search field, a number between 10 and 2000 (the constants SEARCH_FIELD_MIN_MAXIMUM_LENGTH and SEARCH_FIELD_MAX_MAXIMUM_LENGTH).

    getSearchFieldMaximumLength

    public int getSearchFieldMaximumLength()
    Get the Search field length.

    Returns:
    search field length.
